title: I Work Full-Time – How Do I Fit Soroban Into Our Schedule?
description: Getting home at 7pm exhausted, the last thing I wanted was another commitment. Here's how we made Soroban work with our crazy schedule – and you can too.
imageAlt: Working parent supporting child's Soroban practice at home in the evening

content.intro: When I first heard about Soroban, I thought: 'That sounds great, but how? I work all day – who's going to sit with my daughter and teach her?' Turns out there's another way.

sections.text: The Problem: No Time, No Knowledge, No Budget
I read about Soroban – how it helps kids with mental math, builds focus, develops the brain. I wanted my daughter to learn. But:

items: No time to drive her to a Soroban center
Weekends are for family, not running to extra classes
I don't know Soroban myself, so I can't teach her
Private tutors? Way too expensive

sections.text: I thought I'd have to give up on the idea. Until I discovered Soroban learning apps.
Trying Online Learning
I let my daughter try a free trial. The surprise: she could learn by herself.
The app guides step-by-step. What this lesson is about, which beads to move, what the result should be. She didn't need me sitting next to her. I just made myself tea and watched from a distance.
After a few days, I didn't need to sit nearby anymore. She opens the app herself, practices for 15-20 minutes. I cook dinner, do housework – occasionally checking to see what she's working on.
What I Love Most About Online Soroban

items: **Flexible timing:** She can practice anytime – early morning, after dinner, before bed
**I don't need to know Soroban:** The app teaches everything
**Remote progress tracking:** I check her progress on the app, know exactly where she's at
**Much cheaper:** Compared to tutors or learning centers
**Self-motivated learning:** No one forces her – she WANTS to 'level up'

sections.text: The Challenges (Because It's Not Always Easy)
It hasn't always been smooth sailing:

items: **First week required sitting together:** To get her familiar with the app and build the habit
**Some days she's lazy:** Doesn't want to practice. I don't force it – skip that day, try again tomorrow
**Screen time control needed:** Once practice is done, device goes away. No endless screen time
**No human interaction:** Some kids prefer having a real person to talk to

sections.text: If you're feeling guilty about being too busy to help your child with learning – I understand. I felt the same way. But finding the right tool is also a way of caring for your child.
Three Months Later: The Results
My daughter has been using Sorokid for about 3 months now. Here's what I've noticed:

items: Her mental math is noticeably faster
She practices on her own without anyone reminding her
I'm not stressed about supervising her learning anymore
Our evenings are more relaxed

sections.text: I'm not saying this is the perfect method. But for my situation – working all day, not knowing Soroban, no time to drive to classes – this was the best fit.
Our Daily Routine: The 15-Minute Rule
Here's exactly how we fit Soroban into our busy schedule:

items: **When:** Right after dinner, before any screen time
**How long:** 15 minutes, non-negotiable
**Where:** Kitchen table while I clean up
**Reward:** After practice, she can watch her show

sections.text: That's it. No driving. No waiting. Just 15 minutes on the tablet while I'm nearby doing other things. The secret isn't finding MORE time – it's attaching learning to time that already exists.
If You're Also Busy
I'm not telling you to do exactly what I did. Every family is different. But if you're also struggling with helping your child learn because you're too busy, maybe online learning is worth trying.
Being a good parent isn't about spending the most time supervising your child. It's about finding what works best for your child – and your whole family.

faq.question: My child knows nothing about Soroban. Can they still learn online?
faq.answer: Yes! The app teaches from the very beginning – starting with how to recognize numbers on the abacus. No prior knowledge needed.

faq.question: Is online learning as effective as in-person classes?
faq.answer: It depends on your child. Some kids actually learn better online because they can go at their own pace. Others prefer having a real teacher. Try it to see which fits your child.

faq.question: How many minutes per day is enough?
faq.answer: 15-20 minutes is ideal for elementary school kids. Short but consistent beats long but irregular every time.

faq.question: How do I get my child to practice independently?
faq.answer: Sit with them the first week to build the habit. Practice at the same time every day. After 2-3 weeks, the routine forms and they become more self-motivated.

faq.question: Is 15 minutes really enough to make progress?
faq.answer: Yes! Research shows short daily practice beats longer occasional sessions. 15 focused minutes daily adds up to 7.5 hours monthly – that's real learning.

faq.question: What if I can't be present during practice?
faq.answer: The app works independently. Many parents have their kids practice while cooking or doing chores nearby. You don't need to actively supervise every minute.

faq.question: Don't kids need in-person instruction for Soroban?
faq.answer: For fundamentals, apps teach very effectively. In-person instruction adds value for advanced levels or competition prep, but isn't necessary for most kids just learning mental math.

faq.question: What if my child gets bored with the app?
faq.answer: Good apps like Sorokid have gamification – points, levels, achievements – that keep kids engaged. But if interest drops, it's okay to take a short break and come back.

faq.question: How do I track my child's progress without sitting next to them?
faq.answer: Sorokid has a parent dashboard showing what your child practiced, accuracy rates, time spent, and progress over time. You can check it anytime from your phone.

faq.question: Is this cheaper than Soroban classes?
faq.answer: Significantly. In-person Soroban classes typically cost $50-150/month. Apps like Sorokid cost a fraction of that, plus you save on transportation time and gas.

cta.text: Busy schedule? Sorokid fits into just 15 minutes – practice anywhere, anytime, with no commute required.
